body_html: Most IDEs have options to setup "builders" that can be arbitrary commands. Just make a new "builder" that runs "bazel build "... You can ask on stackoverflow is you want to query a larger audience about what they use as an IDE. Closing, as this is not a bug. Thanks!
body_text: Most IDEs have options to setup "builders" that can be arbitrary commands. Just make a new "builder" that runs "bazel build "... You can ask on stackoverflow is you want to query a larger audience about what they use as an IDE. Closing, as this is not a bug. Thanks!
body: Most IDEs have options to setup "builders" that can be arbitrary commands. Just make a new "builder" that runs "bazel build <whatevertarget you want>"... You can ask on stackoverflow is you want to query a larger audience about what they use as an IDE. Closing, as this is not a bug. Thanks!
